title: Barista Training
description: Developed as a proof of concept for how VR training can be utilized in the food service industry, this demo illustrates how hand tracking can create immersive training experiences.</br></br>

title: Crystal Cave
description: A two-player VR experience where participants navigate a 20'x10' area, interacting with eight mid-air haptic devices. This was the first public demonstration of integrating hand tracking data from multiple networked devices.

title: Vista
description: Designed to demonstrate the effectiveness of combining eye tracking and hand tracking in VR experiences. This project showcased how these technologies could be used to control future smart homes.</br></br>

title: XR Launcher and Applications
description: The first public demonstration of running Ultraleap's hand tracking on XR2-based devices. This project featured a series of classic Leap Motion demos ported to Android in a closed-loop system, highlighting hand tracking as the primary input method.

title: Spider
description: A proof of concept for an XR health company, this demo showcased how hand tracking can be used in immersive mental health experiences, specifically for overcoming phobias.

title: Flight Crew Training
description: Developed to explore hand tracking-based locomotion techniques in VR. This project also featured the first public demonstration of hands being virtually blocked by elements in the scene.

title: Trackball Demo
description: Created to showcase various interfaces using mid-air haptics, this demo highlighted different virtual hand-tracking interfaces such as trackballs, sliders, and knobs.

title: Product Customization
description: Designed to demonstrate product exploration and customization in retail shopping.</br></br></br>

title: LBE Showcase
description: Developed in collaboration with an LBE company to illustrate how hand tracking and mid-air haptics can enhance VR experiences.</br></br>

title: Virtual Therapist
description: Part of my thesis work, this embodied conversational agent used both verbal and non-verbal behavior to react to a user's emotional state during a multi-week depression counseling session.
